member.name: T:SFML.Window.ContextSettings
member.summary: Structure defining the creation settings of OpenGL contexts

member.summary: Construct the settings from depth / stencil bits

member.summary: Construct the settings from depth / stencil bits and antialiasing level

member.summary: Construct the settings from depth / stencil bits and antialiasing level
member.param: Major number of the context version
Minor number of the context version

member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.summary: Depth buffer bits (0 is disabled)

member.summary: Stencil buffer bits (0 is disabled)

member.summary: Antialiasing level (0 is disabled)

member.summary: Major number of the context version

member.summary: Minor number of the context version

member.name: T:SFML.Window.EventType
member.summary: Enumeration of the different types of events

member.summary: Event triggered when a window is manually closed

member.summary: Event triggered when a window is resized

member.summary: Event triggered when a window loses the focus

member.summary: Event triggered when a keyboard key is released

member.summary: Event triggered when a mouse button is pressed

member.summary: Event triggered when a mouse button is released

member.summary: Event triggered when the mouse moves within the area of a window

member.summary: Event triggered when the mouse enters the area of a window

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Joystick
member.summary: Give access to the real-time state of the joysticks

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Joystick.Count
member.summary: Maximum number of supported joysticks

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Joystick.ButtonCount
member.summary: Maximum number of supported buttons

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Joystick.AxisCount
member.summary: Maximum number of supported axes

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Joystick.IsConnected(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Check if a joystick is connected
member.param: Index of the joystick to check
member.returns: True if the joystick is connected, false otherwise

members.member:
Return the number of buttons supported by a joystick
If the joystick is not connected, this function returns 0. Index of the joystick Number of buttons supported by the joystick

Check if a joystick supports a given axis
If the joystick is not connected, this function returns false. Index of the joystick Axis to check True if the joystick supports the axis, false otherwise

Check if a joystick button is pressed
If the joystick is not connected, this function returns false. Index of the joystick Button to check True if the button is pressed, false otherwise

Get the current position of a joystick axis
If the joystick is not connected, this function returns 0. Index of the joystick Axis to check Current position of the axis, in range [-100 .. 100]

Update the states of all joysticks
This function is used internally by SFML, so you normally don't have to call it explicitely. However, you may need to call it if you have no window yet (or no window at all): in this case the joysticks states are not updated automatically.

member.summary: Failure to load a resource from memory

member.summary: Failure to load a resource from a file

member.summary: Failure to load a resource from a file

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Mouse
member.summary: Give access to the real-time state of the mouse

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Mouse.IsButtonPressed(SFML.Window.Mouse.Button)
member.summary: Check if a mouse button is pressed
member.returns: True if the button is pressed, false otherwise

members.member:
Get the current position of the mouse
This function returns the current position of the mouse cursor in desktop coordinates. Current position of the mouse

Get the current position of the mouse
This function returns the current position of the mouse cursor relative to a window. Reference window Current position of the mouse

Set the current position of the mouse
This function sets the current position of the mouse cursor in desktop coordinates. New position of the mouse

Set the current position of the mouse
This function sets the current position of the mouse cursor relative to a window. New position of the mouse Reference window

member.name: T:SFML.ObjectBase
member.summary: The ObjectBase class is an abstract base for every SFML object. It's meant for internal use only

member.summary: Construct the object from a pointer to the C library object
member.param: Internal pointer to the object in the C libraries

member.name: M:SFML.ObjectBase.Finalize
member.summary: Dispose the object

member.name: M:SFML.ObjectBase.Dispose
member.summary: Explicitely dispose the object

member.name: M:SFML.ObjectBase.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Destroy the object
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: M:SFML.ObjectBase.Destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Destroy the object (implementation is left to each derived class)
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: M:SFML.ObjectBase.SetThis(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Set the pointer to the internal object. For internal use only
member.param: Pointer to the internal object in C library

member.name: P:SFML.ObjectBase.CPointer
member.summary: Access to the internal pointer of the object. For internal use only

member.summary: Enumeration of window creation styles

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Styles.None
member.summary: No border / title bar (this flag and all others are mutually exclusive)

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Styles.Titlebar
member.summary: Title bar + fixed border

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Styles.Resize
member.summary: Titlebar + resizable border + maximize button

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Styles.Close
member.summary: Titlebar + close button

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Styles.Fullscreen
member.summary: Fullscreen mode (this flag and all others are mutually exclusive))

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Styles.Default
member.summary: Default window style (titlebar + resize + close)

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Window
member.summary: Window is a rendering window ; it can create a new window or connect to an existing one

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(SFML.Window.VideoMode,System.String)
member.summary: Create the window with default style and creation settings

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(SFML.Window.VideoMode,System.String,SFML.Window.Styles)
member.summary: Create the window with default creation settings

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(SFML.Window.VideoMode,System.String,SFML.Window.Styles,SFML.Window.ContextSettings)
member.summary: Create the window

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Create the window from an existing control with default creation settings

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(System.IntPtr,SFML.Window.ContextSettings)
member.summary: Create the window from an existing control

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.IsOpen
member.summary: Tell whether or not the window is opened (ie. has been created). Note that a hidden window (Show(false)) will still return true
member.returns: True if the window is opened

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.Close
member.summary: Close (destroy) the window. The Window instance remains valid and you can call Create to recreate the window

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.Display
member.summary: Display the window on screen

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Change the title of the window

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetIcon(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Change the window's icon
member.param: Array of pixels, format must be RGBA 32 bits

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetVisible(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show or hide the window
member.param: True to show the window, false to hide it

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetMouseCursorVisible(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show or hide the mouse cursor
member.param: True to show, false to hide

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetVerticalSyncEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable / disable vertical synchronization
member.param: True to enable v-sync, false to deactivate

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetKeyRepeatEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable automatic key-repeat. Automatic key-repeat is enabled by default
member.param: True to enable, false to disable

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetActive
member.summary: Activate the window as the current target for rendering
member.returns: True if operation was successful, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetActive(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activate of deactivate the window as the current target for rendering
member.param: True to activate, false to deactivate (true by default)
member.returns: True if operation was successful, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetFramerateLimit(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Limit the framerate to a maximum fixed frequency
member.param: Framerate limit, in frames per seconds (use 0 to disable limit)

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetJoystickThreshold(System.Single)
member.summary: Change the joystick threshold, ie. the value below which no move event will be generated

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.WaitAndDispatchEvents
member.summary: Wait for a new event and dispatch it to the corresponding event handler

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.DispatchEvents
member.summary: Call the event handlers for each pending event

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.ToString
member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor for derived classes
member.param: Pointer to the internal object in the C API

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.PollEvent(SFML.Window.Event@)
member.summary: Internal function to get the next event (non-blocking)
member.param: Variable to fill with the raw pointer to the event structure
member.returns: True if there was an event, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.WaitEvent(SFML.Window.Event@)
member.summary: Internal function to get the next event (blocking)
member.param: Variable to fill with the raw pointer to the event structure

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.InternalGetMousePosition
member.summary: Internal function to get the mouse position relatively to the window. This function is public because it is called by another class of another module, it is not meant to be called by users.

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.InternalSetMousePosition(SFML.Window.Vector2i)
member.summary: Internal function to set the mouse position relatively to the window. This function is public because it is called by another class of another module, it is not meant to be called by users.

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.Destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handle the destruction of the object
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.CallEventHandler(SFML.Window.Event)
member.summary: Call the event handler for the given event
